text.0: to fair goals travel two unlike in semblance each in succession nourishes an infant.
text.1: one bears a godlike babe of golden colour bright and fairshining is he with the other.
text.2: tvaṣṭars ten daughters vigilant and youthful produced this infant borne to sundry quarters.
text.3: they bear around him whose long flames are pointed fulgent among mankind with native splendour.
text.4: three several places of his birth they honour in midair in the heaven and in the waters.
text.5: governing in the east of earthly regions the seasons hath he stablished in their order.
text.6: who of you knows this secret one the infant by his own nature hath brought forth his mothers.
text.7: the germ of many from the waters bosom he goes forth wise and great of godlike nature.
text.8: visible fair he grows in native brightness uplifted in the lap of waving waters.
text.9: when he was born both tvaṣṭars worlds were frightened they turn to him and reverence the lion.
text.10: the two auspicious ones like women tend him like lowing cows they seek him in their manner.
text.11: he is the lord of might among the mighty him on the right they balm with their oblations.
text.12: like savitar his arms with might he stretches awful he strives grasping the worlds two borders.
text.13: he forces out from all a brilliant vesture yea from his mothers draws he forth new raiment.
text.14: he makes him a most noble form of splendour decking him in his home with milk and waters.
text.15: the sage adorns the depths of air with wisdom this is the meeting where the gods are worshipped.
text.16: wide through the firmament spreads forth triumphant the farresplendent strength of thee the mighty.
text.17: kindled by us do thou preserve us agni with all thy selfbright undiminished succours.
text.18: in dry spots he makes stream and course and torrent and inundates the earth with floods that glisten.
text.19: all ancient things within his maw he gathers and moves among the new freshsprouting grasses.
text.20: fed with our fuel purifying agni so blaze to us auspiciously for glory.
text.21: this prayer of ours may varuṇa grant and mitra and aditi and sindhu earth and heaven.
